intro: Pseudabutilon inornatum, commonly known as the slender abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Pseudabutilon inornatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
